subject: Psychology
title: Interference Theory
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Interference Theory.

hook.text: You changed your password and now the old one keeps popping into your head instead of the new one.

buildup.text: Interference theory says forgetting happens when similar memories compete and block each other.

discovery.text: Proactive interference: old memories block new ones. Retroactive: new memories block old ones.

twist.text: The more similar two memories are, the more they interfere. Unique and distinctive memories survive.

climax.text: This explains why learning two similar languages is harder than learning two very different ones.

punchline.text: Memories don't just fade â€” they fight each other.

quiz.question: What is retroactive interference?
options: New memories block recall of older ones
Old memories block learning new ones
Memories from sleep interfere with waking life
